body:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a üëç (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Visits](https://hits.seeyoufarm.com/api/count/incr/badge.svg?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fstreamlit%2Fstreamlit%2Fissues%2F9127&title=visits&edge_flat=false)

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body: Hey @dylanm312 ! Thank you for the issue. I believe this is an issue with Windows users that we resolved with https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/8958. Can you verify this behavior on `streamlit-nightly` (`pip install streamlit-nightly`)? If so, we can close this issue and the fix will be in the next release (set for Thursday currently).

Thanks @kmcgrady! I installed `streamlit-nightly` but am having trouble executing it - `streamlit-nightly run Homepagepy` doesn't seem to work (command not found). I took a look at [the PyPI page](https://pypi.org/project/streamlit-nightly/) for `streamlit-nightly`, but it doesn't say anything about special instructions to run it.

How do I launch the nightly build after installing it?

Ah the executable is still streamlit, so just `streamlit run Homepage.py` You can verify it's the nightly version by loading the About and seeing a `.devXY...` at the end of the version. See screenshot

Thanks! Got it going on the nightly build. Unfortunately the problem still persists.

FYI, my local machine is running macOS, and the containers for our dev/stage/prod environments are running RHEL (image: ubi8/python3.12). So I think it's probably not likely to be the same issue as the Windows-only #8958.
@kmcgrady if you need more info, happy to provide it - otherwise, could you please change `status:awaiting-user-response` to the appropriate value? Thanks! :)

Ah Thanks @dylanm312! I was trying this in my dev environment, and it worked, but it doesn't work in the release version. I have confirmed the issue.

(Also no need to worry about the awaiting-user-response. We use it across the team to check filters for issues that need follow up, I'm removing it now)

issue.title: Redirect pages with removed trailing slashes

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Adding a trailing slash to the url causes confusion on the assets location in Streamlit frontend, so we will filter through a request handler that will redirect to the url without a trailing slash.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

closes #9127

## Testing Plan

- Python unit tests are updated

---
